doc.repnme: Transcript of oral history interview with Siem Aldewereld held on November 2 and 6, 1985
doc.abstracts: In November 1985, Siem Aldewereld was interviewed on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by Dr. Robert W. Oliver. During his tenure at the Bank from 1946 to 1974, Mr. Aldewereld worked in the following areas: as assistant to the treasurer of the World Bank; in the department of technical operations as assistant director (1952-1955) and as director (1955-1972); as vice president of the World Bank and the International Development Association (IDA) (1965-1968); in the projects department as director (1968-1969); and as vice president of finance (1969-1974). His transcript concerns his work as director when he organized the department of technical operations into several functional divisions and introduced project evaluations in a comprehensive manner. He also discusses the relative roles of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and the World Bank in the context of the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD) proposal to ease the creditworthiness of borrowing countries.
